tweets.text: Allermoor spillway stopped running overnight, we have opened Monksleaze Sluice which will enable us to start pumping. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/CxMtrxQiZu

@GeorgeGreenwood My experience is, since February 2017, Newcastle @EnvAgency have been happy to attend lots of meetings with the Council and the owners of a defective sewage system, but wouldn't once come out to the site themselves and sample the discharge ü§®üí©üí©üí©

When rivers are flooded, the current can be strong enough to sweep you away.

We're expecting further river #flooding across central and east England.
 
Check your #flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/QRCVJJglYb

She bluntly sets out how EA's enforcement activity has withered

-The EA now only has resources to attend the most serious incidents. 
-Serious environmental incidents up 27% 
-Prosecutions down 80% 
-Environmental monitoring weakening 
-Water company performance worse

The ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© admits it doesn‚Äôt have enough funding to defeat polluters. Austerity won‚Äôt solve the climate crisis. Ministers must match their funding to the scale of crisis. 

https://t.co/IzaAYLpEZb

tweets.text: Back on Flood Operations Duty Throughout today, barriers at #Hereford #Shrewsbury #Ironbridge #Bewdley still deployed, gates at #Upton #Uckinghall #Deerhurst #Ashleworth still closed and our teams out checking and operating assets @EnvAgencyMids oh and not forgetting the Snow üò≥ https://t.co/WfTLnuLhep

@MariaHerlihyEA @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @johncurtinEA @SteveMooreEA @wifo_ea But then we get punished even more further downstream because they release it all way too quickly. The rise since they have stopped working is unbelievable it really is
New State of the Environment report from @EnvAgency on health, people and the environment. Really useful summary of some key issues incl risks, benefits and inequalities. https://t.co/aVhTszmhQO

Due to recent heavy rainfall, river #flooding is likely in parts of central and east England.

Always stay away from flooded rivers.

Check your flood risk now: https://t.co/BpUpnj1mdd

#StormBella https://t.co/d3sZWbkXBz
24th v 27th December at Brownhills Staunch, River Great Ouse, Over, Cambridgeshire #FloodingUK #Flooding #Cambridgeshire #RiverGreatOuse @EnvAgency https://t.co/yVmabjwi5I

@EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK Why do we have to wait until 2021 for this? Clean river water should be the norm and a priority for @EnvAgency all along. That @EmmaHowardBoyd trumpets this says all you need to know about the terrible job her agency has done for the last decade

@EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK It's a shame this had to be put in place, our rivers should of been clean beforehand. It's great news for this section of river. Know we can start on the rest of the river which should not be used as an open sewer.

@EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK And now the @EnvAgency will have to start properly regulating the water industry, at least on that stretch of the River Wharfe.

That too will be a first.

As part of my reasonable adjustments for Crohn‚Äôs fatigue and post stroke brain damage, I am unable to do a ‚Äònormal‚Äô incident duty role for @EnvAgencyAnglia .. I find this tough, because I hate the thought of letting people down .....
@benharper87 @EnvAgencyAnglia Right. Building on flood plains. Shouldn't even be a discussionü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüôÉ

@richardkendall @EnvAgencyAnglia A lot of building on flood plains upstream in Northampton, means they‚Äôre having to let the water downstream towards peterborough faster than normal. Or so the harbour master here tells me!

Latest Flood Alert for the Lower River Soar in Leicestershire (from Cossington to Redhill at the River Trent).
@MountsorrelPar1 @benvolresponder @LR4x4Response @leicslive @fosse107 @CharnwoodBC @LeicsFireRescue @LeicsCountyHall @EnvAgencyMids @FloodDigitalEA @LeicRutland_ER https://t.co/y9vEZXY5DM

Water levels in the river calder have drop significantly in the last 24 hours. Lots of Rurel Spaces playing their part in Castleford and Methley to prevent properties from flooding @MyWakefield @EnvAgencyYNE @WakefieldLabour https://t.co/QdwHgVUme0
@PaulBurrowsy @EnvAgencyAnglia Loved your reports Paul.  I like to live my life learning something new every day and you always deliver that in spades. Thank you !
I‚Äôve never been to Soham Lode Pumping Station before so a quick detour before I find the flood peak @GsBrand @Elygroupofidbs @EnvAgencyAnglia https://t.co/XCgQPxjISI

#TRRP have been looking out for opportunities to add woody material to brooks & springs, to help slow water during floods and improve habitats! Leaky dams are already provided by nature, see if you can spot one on your next walk! üö∂Thanks to the @EnvAgency for its support! #WEG https://t.co/IOz5WV8kF9

tweets.text: Allermoor Spillway stopped running early this morning, we had personnel out opening Monksleaze Sluice to operate the SOWY at full capacity diverting excess flows from the Parrett as well as switching pumps on at some Langport stations ahead of storm Bella. @EnvAgencySW

As part of the #A120 #LittleHadhamBypass scheme we are working in partnership with the @EnvAgency to provide protection to #LittleHadham residents and downstream communities from being flooded by the River Ash, Albury Tributary and Lloyd Taylor Drain.

https://t.co/NiOL7IQZW1 https://t.co/dOOYgxxekQ

urls.title: A120 bypass (Little Hadham) and flood alleviation scheme
urls.description: Information abour the A120 Little Hadham bypass and flood reduction scheme.

tweets.text: @pippih @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @Trow_Fire_Stn @WiltshireWinter @EnvAgencySW Would be happy to help your community set up a group based on our experience.

@BoATCCEVs @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @Trow_Fire_Stn @WiltshireWinter @EnvAgencySW Great thank you. So you have no input involvement?. Shame as you are doing great work to keep the surrounding areas (boa) safe from flood water. Maybe Trowbridge/Staverton need TCCEVs üëç

@pippih @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @Trow_Fire_Stn @WiltshireWinter As far as I'm aware this is a @WiltshireWinter decision in liason with @EnvAgencySW based on forecast and what's happening on the ground.

@BoATCCEVs @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @Trow_Fire_Stn @WiltshireWinter Who decides when the flood gates are closed to traffic? Would it be useful to have warning "flood" signage further back in the village to give drivers opportunity to turn round or take alternate route?

tweets.text: @Benspaghetti And at 3pm river level had dropped @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/8KEP1rNAEw
A little bit wet in Leatherhead this morning #leatherheadliving https://t.co/oahzrmBK6a
@PaulBurrowsy @EnvAgencyAnglia I really liked the videos Paul. Historically speaking and environmentally - really informative.

We have reports of people in flood waters. Please do not walk, swim or drive through flood water. The rivers are flowing very quickly & you can‚Äôt tell where the edge of the path meet the river. There's many hidden dangers inc raised manhole covers & 30cm of water can move a car.

tweets.text:
#TeamEA are working round the clock to check defences and grids. 

With water levels still high, take care not to walk through flood water as it contains hidden dangers such as lifted manhole covers, sharp objects & chemicals

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MztuI4Ooz5 https://t.co/kWJu7xMMZ1

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: Our teams have been out across the region today, gathering data and assessing impacts from #StormBella. Here, our officer is gathering information at Denford. As flood waters move through catchments, we will work with partners to plan recovery activities #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/zoAEzifdOq

If you‚Äôre planning a big end of year clear out, be careful who you hire to dispose of your waste. Waste criminals pose as genuine waste collectors, take people's money but dump the waste illegally, putting our environment at risk.  

Share this video to let others know. https://t.co/NybBUaD4X8

Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/cStzUAbhhi https://t.co/HCws1Z2qjR
Work back underway at Cowick today, looking to strengthen the breach repair works on the Aire & Calder.  @CRTYorkshireNE @EnvAgencyYNE @ERfloodrisk https://t.co/r4pFf6LvEM

Thanks to  @EnvAgency @mickgeorgeltd @Ameyplc for supplying pumps to help with the situation at our Chear Fen Pumping Station. Also thank you the Board Members who have stepped into help. Great example of partnership working! https://t.co/mejvzTXhcK

9.40am, Monday

We still many flood warnings and alerts in place...

Please check your area...

Get the latest here: https://t.co/3BhMIvEYbG

Plus great advice... like moving valuables upstairs, and putting medicines in a bag...
#floodaware https://t.co/PXlIJe8zVh

tweets.text:
3/3 Our field teams continue to clear assets of blockages and debris that‚Äôs washed in and maintaining the pumps.

Our flood maps and river levels can be viewed here: https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15

2/3 Pumping continues at Crossmoor, Saltmoor, Northmoor, Stockmoor, Westonzoyland and Stanmoor Pumping Stations.

As rivers and moors respond to yesterday‚Äôs rainfall and today‚Äôs showers, water levels could rise, with the majority of water coming down the Tone.

1/3 A very similar picture to yesterday in the Somerset Levels and Moors: Hookbridge, Beazleys and Allermoor spillways continue to run and upstream pumps will remain off until river levels allow them to resume. https://t.co/UXFWCYHrRu
Flood alerts issued for Malton area https://t.co/AH66zWs6aa

@opaqueentity @CambsCops Hi @opaqueentity, on the sign up for Flood Warnings, postcode entry page, there is a link under the text input box where you can search by town or city. This should allow you to set up alerts for your local area.  Thanks Charlotte
Nice to see data from @EnvAgency's register of Large Raised Reservoirs making its way into Wikipedia articles https://t.co/Y1PBydnQqj HT @pigsonthewing #opendata

tweets.text: This is what #floodwardens like to see. Level starting to fall now. Some rain on the radar & forecast for this pm but shouldn't be enough to cause too many problemsü§û. @EnvAgencySW barriers will be up for the rest of the day to be sure. @DWFRSBoA @WiltshireWinter @Trow_Fire_Stn https://t.co/GphaCpHVPX

I‚Äôm no hydrologist expert but even I was getting worried about water levels in Buckingham in the early afternoon of 23/12 but sadly @EnvAgencyAnglia ignored their own telemetry and didn‚Äôt call it a flood until circa 23:15 - which was far too late. https://t.co/mwx1ruiN90

There are still a number of flood warnings in place across England. 

Avoid walking or driving through flood water ‚ö†Ô∏è

Check your #flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/pyyYmPFIoR
Earith is some 40km inland at the fluvial and tidal interface within the Great Ouse catchment. It is a key pressure point in the system @EnvAgencyAnglia #ousewashes https://t.co/uVJ03CxTtc
